translated: When they see forms with their eyes, they do not grasp at their characteristics

original: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin to //
translated: or apprehend their signs.

original: gzhi gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the basis for this?

original: mig gi dbang po'i sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas pa ni /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas pa ni /
translated: They do not remain unrestrained by the restraint of the eye faculty.

original: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba dag 'byung bas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams sems kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba dag 'byung bas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams sems kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and in the world, covetousness and mental dissatisfaction arise, so that sinful, unwholesome dharmas follow after thought.

original: de rnams bsdam pa'i phyir bsgrub cing bsrung bar mig gis dbang pos mig gi dbang po sdom par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams bsdam pa'i phyir bsgrub cing bsrung bar mig gis dbang pos mig gi dbang po sdom par byed do //
translated: In order to restrain them, he practices and guards the eye faculty, restraining the eye faculty.

original: de bzhin du rna bas sgra dang / snam dri dang / lces ro dang / lus kyis reg bya dang / yid kyis chos rnams shes nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna bas sgra dang / snam dri dang / lces ro dang / lus kyis reg bya dang / yid kyis chos rnams shes nas mtshan mar mi 'dzin /
translated: Similarly, having cognized sounds with the ear, smells with the nose, tastes with the tongue, tactile objects with the body, and dharmas with the mind, he does not grasp at signs

original: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin to //
translated: and does not grasp at secondary characteristics.🔽For what reason?

original: gzhi gang gi phyir zhe na /🔽yid kyi dbang po'i @160a *//
analyzed: gzhi gang gi phyir zhe na / yid kyi dbang po'i @160a *//
translated: Because,

original: sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas pa ni /
analyzed: sdom pas ma bsdams par gnas pa ni /
translated: if one dwells unrestrained by the restraint of the mind faculty,

original: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba dag 'byung bas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams sems kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba dag 'byung bas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams sems kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and in the world, covetousness and mental dissatisfaction arise, so that sinful, unwholesome dharmas follow after thought.

original: de rnams bsdam pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang pos yid kyi dbang po sdom par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams bsdam pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang pos yid kyi dbang po sdom par byed do //
translated: In order to restrain them, he practices and guards the mind faculty, restraining the mind faculty.

original: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po de dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa de dang ldan pas nang gi bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa nyams su myong zhing /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po de dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa de dang ldan pas nang gi bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa nyams su myong zhing /
translated: Endowed with that aggregate of noble morality and that restraint of the senses, he experiences inner bliss that is irreproachable.

original: de 'gro ba dang ldog pa la shes bzhin du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de 'gro ba dang ldog pa la shes bzhin du gnas pa yin te /
translated: He is aware when he goes out and when he comes back.

original: lta ba dang / rnam par lta ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed thogs pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang /
analyzed: lta ba dang / rnam par lta ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed thogs pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang /
translated: He is aware when he looks ahead and when he looks around. He is aware when he bends and when he stretches his limbs. He is aware when he carries his double-robe, his Dharma robes, and his alms-bowl. He is aware when he walks, stands, sits, lies down, does not lie down,

original: smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyis dub pa bsal ba la shes bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyis dub pa bsal ba la shes bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
translated: speaks, is silent, and removes fatigue from sleep.

original: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po de dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa de dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin mchog de dang ldan pas nang gi bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa nyams su myong zhing /
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po de dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa de dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin mchog de dang ldan pas nang gi bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa nyams su myong zhing /
translated: With that aggregate of noble discipline, with that restraint of the senses, and with that supreme mindfulness and alertness, they experience the bliss of the inner good.

original: de gnas mal dben pa /
analyzed: de gnas mal dben pa /
translated: They live in solitary places,

original: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khang stong dag tu gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: dgon pa dang / shing drung dang / khang stong dag tu gnas pa yin te /
translated: in the forest, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty building.

original: dgon par son kyang rung /
analyzed: dgon par son kyang rung /
translated: Whether they have gone to the forest,

original: shing drung du son kyang rung /
analyzed: shing drung du son kyang rung /
translated: to the foot of a tree,

original: khang stong du son kyang rung 'dug ste skyil mo krung bcas nas lus drung bor bsrang ste dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag nas de 'jig rten la brnab sems spangs te /
analyzed: khang stong du son kyang rung 'dug ste skyil mo krung bcas nas lus drung bor bsrang ste dran pa mngon du phyogs par bzhag nas de 'jig rten la brnab sems spangs te /
translated: or to an empty building, they sit down, cross their legs, hold their body erect, and establish mindfulness in front of them. They abandon worldly covetousness,

original: brnab sems dang @160b bral ba'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas shing brnab sems las sems yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: brnab sems dang @160b bral ba'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas shing brnab sems las sems yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: and with a mind free from covetousness they live with many such states, purifying their minds of covetousness.

original: 'jig rten la gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom spangs te /🔽yid gnyis las brgal pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten la gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom spangs te / yid gnyis las brgal pa yin /
translated: regret, and doubt.🔽He has crossed over doubt.

original: the tshom las brgal ba yin //
analyzed: the tshom las brgal ba yin //
translated: He has crossed over uncertainty.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams las nges pa thob pa yin /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams las nges pa thob pa yin /
translated: He has attained certainty in wholesome qualities.

original: the tshom las sems yongs su sbyangs ba yin no //
analyzed: the tshom las sems yongs su sbyangs ba yin no //
translated: He has purified his mind of doubt.

original: ma sdug / dper na /
analyzed: ma sdug / dper na /
translated: “Dear, it is like this.

original: mi zhig gis skyin po zhig blangs nas las kyi mtha' rnams la brtson par byas /
analyzed: mi zhig gis skyin po zhig blangs nas las kyi mtha' rnams la brtson par byas /
translated: Suppose a man took out a loan and applied himself to his work.

original: de'i las kyi mtha' de rnams grub nas /
analyzed: de'i las kyi mtha' de rnams grub nas /
translated: After completing his work,

original: des de las bu lon de yang khyer la /
analyzed: des de las bu lon de yang khyer la /
translated: he took the money from the loan

original: de la chung ma gso ba chog tsam zhig kyang yod nas /
analyzed: de la chung ma gso ba chog tsam zhig kyang yod nas /
translated: and had just enough to support his wife.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought,

original: bdag gis skyin po blangs nas las kyi mtha' rnams la brtson par byas te /
analyzed: bdag gis skyin po blangs nas las kyi mtha' rnams la brtson par byas te /
translated: ‘I took out a loan and applied myself to my work.

original: bdag gis las kyi mtha' de rnams grub nas bdag gis de las bu lon yang gzhal bdag la chung ma gso ba chog tsam zhig kyang yod do //
analyzed: bdag gis las kyi mtha' de rnams grub nas bdag gis de las bu lon yang gzhal bdag la chung ma gso ba chog tsam zhig kyang yod do //
translated: “When I have finished my work, I will pay back my debt and have enough to support my wife.”🔽He was happy about that.

original: snyam ste / de gzhi de las bde bar gyur /🔽yid bde bar gyur ba dang / ma sdug /
analyzed: snyam ste / de gzhi de las bde bar gyur / yid bde bar gyur ba dang / ma sdug /
translated: “My dear,

original: dper na / mi nad pa nad tshabs che ba /
analyzed: dper na / mi nad pa nad tshabs che ba /
translated: it’s like when a person is sick, very sick,

original: sdug bsngal ba zhig yod la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba zhig yod la /
translated: and suffering.

original: de zas zos pa ni /
analyzed: de zas zos pa ni /
translated: When they eat food,

original: lus la 'jur mi btub /
analyzed: lus la 'jur mi btub /
translated: it doesn’t agree with them.

original: skom 'thungs pa ni /
analyzed: skom 'thungs pa ni /
translated: When they drink,

original: khong du gnod par gyur pa las /
analyzed: khong du gnod par gyur pa las /
translated: it does them harm.

original: de dus gzhan zhig na nad med cing stobs dang ldan la bde bar gyur te /
analyzed: de dus gzhan zhig na nad med cing stobs dang ldan la bde bar gyur te /
translated: But at another time, they are healthy, strong, and happy.

original: de kha zas zos pa 'jur btub /
analyzed: de kha zas zos pa 'jur btub /
translated: When they eat food,🔽it agrees with them.

original: skom 'thungs pa ni /
analyzed: skom 'thungs pa ni /
translated: When they drink,

original: khong du gnod par ma gyur nas /
analyzed: khong du gnod par ma gyur nas /
translated: it does them no harm.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think,

original: 'di ltar / bdag sngon na ba nad tshabs che ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag sngon na ba nad tshabs che ba /
translated: ‘When I was sick, very sick,

original: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa na /
translated: and suffering,

original: bdag gis kha zas zos pa ni /🔽lus la @161a *//
analyzed: bdag gis kha zas zos pa ni / lus la @161a *//
translated: when I ate food,

original: 'jur mi btub /
analyzed: 'jur mi btub /
translated: it didn’t agree with me.🔽When I drank,🔽it did me harm.

original: skom 'thungs pa ni khong du gnod par gyur pa las /
analyzed: skom 'thungs pa ni khong du gnod par gyur pa las /
translated: The water I drank did not harm my stomach.

original: da ni 'di ltar bdag nad med cing stobs dang ldan pas bde bar gyur te /
analyzed: da ni 'di ltar bdag nad med cing stobs dang ldan pas bde bar gyur te /
translated: Now, I am healthy and strong, and I feel good.

original: bdag gis zas zos pa ni lus la 'jur btub /
analyzed: bdag gis zas zos pa ni lus la 'jur btub /
translated: The food I ate was able to enter my body.

original: skom 'thungs pa ni khong du gnod par ma gyur to snyam ste /
analyzed: skom 'thungs pa ni khong du gnod par ma gyur to snyam ste /
translated: The water I drank did not harm my stomach.’

original: de gzhi de las bde ba dang / yid bde bar gyur pa dang / ma sdug /
analyzed: de gzhi de las bde ba dang / yid bde bar gyur pa dang / ma sdug /
translated: On that basis, he feels happy and content,

original: dper na / mi zhig bran du gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig bran du gyur te /
translated: For example, a person is a slave,

original: mngag gzhug pa dang / go re long ba dang / lto khol dang / rang dbang med par gyur pa las /
analyzed: mngag gzhug pa dang / go re long ba dang / lto khol dang / rang dbang med par gyur pa las /
translated: a servant, a menial, a bondservant, and has no independence.

original: de dus gzhan zhig na bran mi byed par gyur te /
analyzed: de dus gzhan zhig na bran mi byed par gyur te /
translated: At another time, he is not a slave,

original: mngag gzhug mi byed /🔽go re long mi byed /
analyzed: mngag gzhug mi byed / go re long mi byed /
translated: not a servant,🔽not a menial,

original: lto khol mi byed de /
analyzed: lto khol mi byed de /
translated: not a bondservant,

original: rang dbang yod nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rang dbang yod nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: and has independence.

original: 'di ltar / bdag sngon bran du gyur pa na mngag gzhug pa dang / go re long ba dang / lto khol dang / rang dbang med pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag sngon bran du gyur pa na mngag gzhug pa dang / go re long ba dang / lto khol dang / rang dbang med pa las /
translated: He thinks, ‘Previously, when I was a slave, I was a servant, a menial, a bondservant, and had no independence.

original: da ni bran mi byed pas mngag gzhug mi byed /
analyzed: da ni bran mi byed pas mngag gzhug mi byed /
translated: Now I am not a slave, so I am not ordered around.

original: go re long mi byed /
analyzed: go re long mi byed /
translated: I am not a servant, so I am not made to work.🔽I am free.

original: rang dbang yod do snyam nas de gzhi de las bde bar gyur /🔽yid bde bar gyur pa dang / ma sdug /
analyzed: rang dbang yod do snyam nas de gzhi de las bde bar gyur / yid bde bar gyur pa dang / ma sdug /
translated: Thinking this, he is happy and content.

original: dper na / mi zhig btson du bzung ste /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig btson du bzung ste /
translated: For example, suppose a man is imprisoned

original: lag pa phyin ka log tu dam du bcings par gyur pa las /
analyzed: lag pa phyin ka log tu dam du bcings par gyur pa las /
translated: and his hands are tightly bound behind his back.

original: de de las nor gzhal ba med par bde bar legs par thar nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de de las nor gzhal ba med par bde bar legs par thar nas de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He is released from that without paying a ransom.

original: 'di ltar / bdag sngon btson du bzung ste lag pa phyin ka log tu dam du bcings par gyur pa las /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag sngon btson du bzung ste lag pa phyin ka log tu dam du bcings par gyur pa las /
translated: He thinks, “Previously I was imprisoned and my hands were tightly bound behind my back.

original: da ni de las bdag nong gzhal ba med par bde bar legs par thar te snyam ste /
analyzed: da ni de las bdag nong gzhal ba med par bde bar legs par thar te snyam ste /
translated: Now I have been released from that without paying a ransom.”

original: de gzhi de las @161b yid bde bar gyur pa dang / ma sdug /
analyzed: de gzhi de las @161b yid bde bar gyur pa dang / ma sdug /
translated: Thinking this, he is happy and content.

original: dper na / mi zhig 'jigs pa las bde ba dang / lo nyes pa las lo legs par gyur nas /
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig 'jigs pa las bde ba dang / lo nyes pa las lo legs par gyur nas /
translated: For example, suppose a man is happy to be free from danger,🔽and happy to have a good harvest after a famine.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks, “Previously I was in danger.

original: 'di ltar / bdag 'jigs pa las bde ba dang / lo nyes pa las lo legs par gyur to snyam ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag 'jigs pa las bde ba dang / lo nyes pa las lo legs par gyur to snyam ste /
translated: and I have had a good harvest, free from famine.”

original: de gzhi de las bde bar gyur /
analyzed: de gzhi de las bde bar gyur /
translated: He is happy and joyful on that basis.

original: dga' bar gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dga' bar gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: des bdag nyid kyi sgrib pa lnga po skyin po ji lta ba dang / nad ji lta ba dang / bran ji lta ba dang / btson ji lta ba dang / 'jigs pa ji lta ba de dag spangs par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: des bdag nyid kyi sgrib pa lnga po skyin po ji lta ba dang / nad ji lta ba dang / bran ji lta ba dang / btson ji lta ba dang / 'jigs pa ji lta ba de dag spangs par yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: he sees that he has abandoned the five hindrances, which are like debts, like a disease, like slavery, like imprisonment, and like danger.

original: de sgrib pa lnga po sems nye ba'i nyon mongs par byed pa /
analyzed: de sgrib pa lnga po sems nye ba'i nyon mongs par byed pa /
translated: The five hindrances are mental afflictions that are close to the mind.

original: shes rab nyam chung par byed pa /
analyzed: shes rab nyam chung par byed pa /
translated: They weaken wisdom.

original: gnod pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa /
analyzed: gnod pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa /
translated: They are in the category of harm.🔽They are not in accord with nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi mthun pa dag spangs nas 'dod pa dag las dben /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mi mthun pa dag spangs nas 'dod pa dag las dben /
translated: He has abandoned them and is free from desire,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben /🔽rtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben / rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: free from evil, unwholesome things.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas /
translated: He has thinking and reflection.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
translated: He has joy and happiness born of seclusion.

original: bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //🔽dper na / khrus mkhan nam /🔽khrus mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig kham phor ram /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so // dper na / khrus mkhan nam / khrus mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig kham phor ram /
translated: He abides in the first concentration, which is free from desires and negative influences, and is accompanied by investigation and analysis, born of seclusion, and filled with rapture and joy.🔽For example, a skilled bathman or bathman’s apprentice would pour fine bath powder into a metal basin or wooden tub,

original: gzhong bu'am / nya phyis kyi nang du 'dag chal gyi phye ma zhib mo chus yang btab yang btab ste spangs na /
analyzed: gzhong bu'am / nya phyis kyi nang du 'dag chal gyi phye ma zhib mo chus yang btab yang btab ste spangs na /
translated: sprinkle it with water, and knead it.

original: 'dag chal gyi gong bu de gsher gsher dang ldan /
analyzed: 'dag chal gyi gong bu de gsher gsher dang ldan /
translated: The ball of bath powder would be moist,

original: gsher gyis zhen te /🔽gsher gyis phyi nang khyab pas 'bo bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gsher gyis zhen te / gsher gyis phyi nang khyab pas 'bo bar mi 'gyur /
translated: soaked with water,🔽and pervaded inside and out, so that it would not crumble or fall apart.

original: 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /🔽dge slong de'i lus dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde bas mngon du rlan par byed /
analyzed: 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du / dge slong de'i lus dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde bas mngon du rlan par byed /
translated: In the same way,🔽the monk’s body is saturated,🔽soaked,

original: yongs su rlan par byed /🔽yongs su tshim par byed /🔽yongs @162a *// su khyab par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su rlan par byed / yongs su tshim par byed / yongs @162a *// su khyab par byed de /
translated: satisfied, and permeated with the pleasure and joy born of seclusion.

original: de'i lus thams cad la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i lus thams cad la 'di lta ste /
translated: There is nowhere in his entire body

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde bas ma khyab pa'am /🔽khyab par ma gyur pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde bas ma khyab pa'am /🔽khyab par ma gyur pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: that is not pervaded by the pleasure and joy born of seclusion.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing /
translated: He is free from thought and discernment.

original: nang yongs su dang ste sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas /🔽rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: nang yongs su dang ste sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas / rtog pa med pa /
translated: His mind is completely pure and unified.

original: dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa /
translated: He is without thought and without discernment.

original: ting 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
analyzed: ting 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
translated: He is filled with the joy and bliss born of samādhi.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He has attained and abides in the second concentration.

original: de 'di ltar /🔽lus 'di la ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde bas mngon du rlan par byed /
analyzed: de 'di ltar / lus 'di la ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde bas mngon du rlan par byed /
translated: In this way,

original: yongs su rlan par byed /🔽yongs su tshim par byed //🔽yongs su khyab par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su rlan par byed / yongs su tshim par byed // yongs su khyab par byed de /
translated: he drenches, steeps, fills, and pervades his body with the joy and bliss born of samādhi.

original: de'i lus thams cad la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i lus thams cad la 'di lta ste /
translated: There is not the slightest part of his body

original: ting 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde bas ma khyab pa'am /🔽khyab par ma gyur pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: ting 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde bas ma khyab pa'am / khyab par ma gyur pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: that is not pervaded by the joy and bliss born of samādhi.

original: dper na / ri'i rtse na bkod ma'i mtsho phran zhig yod par gyur la /
analyzed: dper na / ri'i rtse na bkod ma'i mtsho phran zhig yod par gyur la /
translated: It is like a spring on a mountain peak.
